channel.title: Algebraic Topology by Hatcher on Adar Kahiri
channel.description: Recent content in Algebraic Topology by Hatcher on Adar Kahiri

item.title: Basic Constructions
item.description: Problem 1 Show that composition of paths satisfies the following cancellation property: If \(f_0 g_0 \simeq f_1 g_1\) and \(g_0 \simeq g_1\) then \(f_0 \simeq f_1\). We first show that \(f_0\) and \(f_1\) have the same endpoints. Since \(f_0 g_0 \simeq f_1 g_1\), \(f_0(0) = f_1(0)\). Since \(g_0 \simeq g_1\), \(g_0(0) = g_1(0)\), and since we're dealing with path compositions, we know that \(f_0(1) = g_0(0)\) and \(f_1(1) = g_1(0)\), which means \(f_0(1) = f_1(1)\).

item.title: Problems
item.description: Problem 10 Show that a space \(X\) is contractible if and only if every map \(f: X \rightarrow Y\), for arbitrary \(Y\), is nullhomotopic. Similarly, show \(X\) is contractible if and only if every map \(f: Y \rightarrow X\) is nullhomotopic. If \(X\) is contractible, then its identity map \(\mathbb{I}: X \rightarrow X\) is nullhomotopic. Let \(h: X \times I \rightarrow X\) be a homotopy between \(\mathbb{I}\) and a constant map (This map exists since the identity is nullhomotopic).
